greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of primes p <= n that are congruent to 2 modulo 3.
link: Jianing Song, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
example: There are 13 primes <= 100 that are congruent to 2 modulo 3, namely 2, 5, 11, 17, 23, 29, 41, 47, 53, 59, 71, 83, 89, so a(100) = 13.
results.author: _Jianing Song_, Apr 28 2021
